conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles from points A, B, C, and D, we need to analyze the flow paths of the liquid based on the provided images.
From Image 1, liquid will flow out from points A, B, C, and D, which are located at the top of the image.
In Image 2, the initial flow of liquids from points A, B, C, and D is shown with colors corresponding to the points: Blue for A, Cyan for B, Yellow for C, and Orange for D.
In Image 3, the flow paths have been further extended: Blue liquid (from A) flows down vertically and then turns right, moving towards the right side of the image.
In Image 3, Cyan liquid (from B) flows down diagonally and then turns left, moving towards the left side of the image.
In Image 3, Yellow liquid (from C) flows down vertically and then turns right, moving towards the right side of the image.
In Image 3, Orange liquid (from D) flows down diagonally and then turns left, moving towards the left side of the image.
The blue and yellow liquids (from points A and C) flow towards the right and end up in container F.
The cyan and orange liquids (from points B and D) flow towards the left and end up in container E.
Liquids from points A and C will flow into container F, and liquids from points B and D will flow into container E.
